The debate over decriminalising cannabis continues particularly in the US where two states have legalised it for recreational use. In California, marijuana for medicinal purposes has been legal for years. But the campaign to make it more widely available is being led by, well you might be surprised, where Alastair Leithead is reporting from.

So let's gather round the table here. I'm gonna bring this salad out. As you can see...

Cheryl Shuman has been cooking for a few well-to-do friends, who share an unusual interest reflected in their lunch menu.

I made a nice, fresh, grilled chicken salad with you with some fresh cannabis leaves and also the red peppers and the yellow peppers have been salted and a cannabis infused olive oil that we make at the Beverly Hills Cannabis Club that I grow with my own little garden.

Yep, you heard it right, the Beverly Hills Cannabis Club, a different phase to the "legalise marijuana campaign" with a controversial message.

Cannabis makes me a better mom.
It really does.
And it makes her a better daughter. It really does. No, I'm not kidding, listen.

Her daughter Amy explained the problem. This woman, when she was going through her cancer treatments, it was like having a zombie as a mother. And when she started cannabis therapy, she was smiling, she was happy. We had our mom back.
